section_title: Tryon International Equestrian Center — Venue Profile
section_overview: Mill Spring’s show campus is built for volume and flow: big competition rings, ample warm-up, and direct paths from stabling to in-gates so you can stack trips without scrambling. Vendor row sits close to the barns for fast tack fixes and caffeine runs. Expect posted schooling blocks, efficient tractor drags, and a straightforward jog strip—plan your hack windows and keep a ring bag ready for quick swaps between equitation, derbies, and the GP ring.
section_img_alt: Stadium arena and warm-up at Tryon International Equestrian Center in Mill Spring, NC
section_meta_description: Insider venue profile for Tryon International Equestrian Center: warm-up flow, jog strip basics, vendor row access, and stabling tips for A-circuit riders.

section_spotlight.title: Quick Hits for Show Week
bullets: Warm-up ring: call your lines early, pass left-to-left, and use off-peak windows for flatting to avoid in-gate compression.
Jog strip: arrive polished and five minutes early; number visible; keep a rag handy for last-second boot wipe before the jog.
Vendor row: close to stabling—phone-ahead for studs, spur straps, or braiding yarn; stash a mini kit in your ring bag.
Stabling: aisles get active—trunks flush, hoses coiled; respect quiet hours; lunging only in designated spaces.
Logistics: golf carts and bikes share lanes—lead horses at pinch points; allow extra minutes during tractor drags and big ring changeovers.
Weather: afternoon pop-ups are common—pack a cooler, rain sheet, and towel; confirm footing status with the in-gate before schooling.
Food & fuel: on-site options near vendor row; mobile-order when possible to keep you within range of the in-gate.
